Question.Text: A 26-year-old German student presents to the clinic because of an itchy swelling on her left leg. The skin surrounding the swelling is slightly hyperaemic. The boil is covered by a blackish scab

Answer: Furuncular myiasis (Tumbu fly/Cordylobia anthropophaga infestation) - The patient presents with a pruritic boil-like lesion with central punctum. The images show a furuncular lesion with central breathing hole and fly larvae (maggots) being extracted from subcutaneous tissue, typical of botfly larvae infestation acquired from contaminated soil or clothing.
